thread.title: Game time announced for Maryland-Penn State in Baltimore
thread.title_full: Game time announced for Maryland-Penn State in Baltimore

author: Daniel Gallen
title: Game time announced for Maryland-Penn State in Baltimore
text:
Daniel Gallen Contact Reporter Maryland-Penn State in Baltimore will be a 3:30 p.m. kick. 
Maryland's game against Penn State at M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore on Oct. 24 will kick off at 3:30 p.m. and be televised on either ABC, ESPN or ESPN2, Penn State announced Monday . 
Through its first six games of the season, Maryland has had five noon starts and one 3 p.m. start. The Oct. 3 matchup against Michigan that was scheduled to be a prime-time kickoff was moved to noon because of impending inclement weather from Hurricane Joaquin. 
The game will be the first for Maryland after coach Randy Edsall was fired and offensive coordinator Mike Locksley's first as interim coach. It will be Locksley's first game serving as a team's head coach since his final game at New Mexico on Sept. 24, 2011. 
Penn State has won five straight games after losing its season opener to Temple. The Nittany Lions play at No. 1 Ohio State on Saturday night in an effort to clinch bowl eligibility and pull off a major upset. Maryland is 2-4 after Saturday's loss to the Buckeyes but will have a bye week to prepare for the matchup.
